title.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Nonproliferation Assistance Programs - Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund

description.narrative: Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund - Unspecified Enforcement/Interdiction: National Security Interest; The Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund (NDF) provides a means for the USG to respond rapidly to high priority nonproliferation and disarmament opportunities, circumstances, or conditions that are unanticipated or unusually difficult. NDF projects aim to destroy, secure, or prevent the proliferation of WMD, WMD-related materials and delivery systems, and destabilizing conventional weapons.

title.narrative: Preservation of the Ruins of the 14th-Century Church of St. John Aliturgetos in the Ancient City of Nessebar

description.narrative: The citys largest late medieval monument, the ruined church is a well-known and heavily visited landmark in Bulgaria because of its architecture and its prime location above the port. This project involves the development of feasibility, and conceptual and detailed design studies in preparation for the sites eventual conservation.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Preservation of the Ruins of the 14th-Century Church of St. John Aliturgetos in the Ancient City of Nessebar, Phase 2

description.narrative: This 14th century church, a World Heritage site, is the largest late medieval monument in Nessebar. A continuation of work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant, this project involves structural stabilization and conservation of the faade decoration.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 11th-Century Church of St. Todor in Boboshevo

description.narrative: To support the conservation of the ruins of the 11th-century Church of St. Todor, a rare surviving monument of the First Bulgarian Empire (681-1018).Exposed to the elements following the recent collapse of its protective covering, the ruined church is minimally shielded by plastic tarps. This project involves the comprehensive documentation of the site, construction of a new protective cover, and the development of a site conservation plan.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Conservation of the 3rd-Century BC Thracian Tomb of Sveshtari

description.narrative: Discovered in 1982 near the village of Sveshtari, this 3rd-century BC tomb has a unique architectural decor, with polychrome half-human, half-plant caryatids and painted murals. The project, which includes the documentation and conservation of the tomb, directly supports the Embassy's efforts to strengthen shared Euro-Atlantic values and build partnerships to maintain Bulgarias western orientation.
